title: How to Remove Guides in Illustrator

steps.title: Open your project in Illustrator.
steps.content: Open your project in Illustrator. You can either open Illustrator, then go to File > Open or you can right-click your project file and select Open with > Illustrator .

steps.title: Click View.
steps.content: Click View . You'll see this menu at the top of the screen and another menu will drop-down.

steps.title: Hover your mouse over Guides.
steps.content: Hover your mouse over Guides . Another menu will pop out.

steps.title: Click Clear Guides.
steps.content: Click Clear Guides . This will remove all guides from your screen.

steps.title: Open your project in Illustrator.
steps.content: Open your project in Illustrator. You can either open Illustrator, then go to File > Open or you can right-click your project file and select Open with > Illustrator .

steps.title: Select the guide you want to remove.
steps.content: Select the guide you want to remove. Click it to select it; if you're having trouble with layers getting in the way, you can click the guide's end-point on the ruler that surrounds your project.

steps.title: Press ← Backspace (Windows) or Delete (Mac).
steps.content: Press ← Backspace (Windows) or Delete (Mac). If this keyboard shortcut does not work for you, go to Edit > Cut/Edit > Clear . The individual guide you selected will be deleted.

steps.title: Open your project in Illustrator.
steps.content: Open your project in Illustrator. You can either open Illustrator, then go to File > Open or you can right-click your project file and select Open with > Illustrator .

steps.title: Select the guide you want to move.
steps.content: Select the guide you want to move. Click it to select it; if you're having trouble with layers getting in the way, you can click the guide's end-point on the ruler that surrounds your project.

steps.title: Drag and drop it.
steps.content: Drag and drop it. You can freely move the guide if you have guides unlocked. [1] X Research source
